intro: Hepetis ramosa, commonly known as the branched hebeth, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its branched stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, come in shades of purple and pink, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hepetis ramosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
